Description/Context: Debug dialogue that plays when the game tries to load a voiceline that doesn't exist in this document.
Dialogue: Sorry, the voiceline you tried to play doesn't actually exist.
Speaker: Mabel

Description/Context: Debug dialogue that plays when the voiceline exists in this document, but hasn't actually been recorded yet.
Dialogue: This voiceline hasn't been recorded yet.
Speaker: Mabel

Description/Context: Test dialogue that's just stolen voicelines from the Professor Layton games.
Dialogue: I knew you would be an asset in my battle against them!
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: What an ugly, little man you are!
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: Apparently, I made a pact with a small-minded dullard!
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: The puzzle is clearly flawed.
Speaker: Descole

Description/Context: Test dialogue to make sure that multiple sentence voicelines work properly.
Dialogue: I have been waiting patiently for the perfect moment to make my grand entrance.
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: The final act belongs to me!
Speaker: Descole

Description/Context: The neat thing is, this one doesn't actually exist. Its sole purpose is to trigger the voiceline not recorded voiceline.
Dialogue: Surprise, assholes! Turns out I was the Big Dog the whole time!
Speaker: Descole

Description/Context: Descole's opening monalogue in Professor Layton and the Last Specter. Mostly just to test how flexible multiple voicelines are.
Dialogue: Long ago, in a lawless age,
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: a pack of bandits invaded a small village.
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: Amidst the chaos, a terrified young farm girl
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: played her flute to drown out the madness.
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: As the music spiraled high into the sky,
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: a giant specter appeared above her.
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: She begged the specter to destroy the bandits, and it swiftly obeyed.
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: The town was saved;
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: and the specter vanished just as quickly as it had appeared.
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: But the farm girl knew that in times of danger,
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: she needed only to play the flute,
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: and the specter would appear again.
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: [Book shuts]
A quaint tale, wouldn't you say?
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: I think the time has come
Speaker: Descole

Dialogue: for us to pen the next chapter...
Speaker: Descole
